name: webmin
description: Webmin is a self-hosted web-based interface for administering Unix-like systems. It provides modules for managing services, users, DNS, and more through a browser instead of command line alone.
features: System administration: Manage Unix/Linux servers through a web interface without command-line access.
User management: Create, modify, and delete system users and groups with password and permission controls.
Service control: Start, stop, restart, and configure system services like Apache, MySQL, or SSH.
File management: Browse, edit, upload, and download files with a built-in file manager and text editor.
Package management: Install, update, and remove software packages using your distribution's package manager.
Network configuration: Configure network interfaces, routing, firewall rules, and DNS settings.
Disk management: Partition disks, create filesystems, manage RAID arrays, and monitor disk usage.
Backup scheduling: Set up automated backups of files, databases, and system configurations.
Log viewer: Browse and search system logs for troubleshooting and monitoring purposes.
Module system: Extend functionality with hundreds of available modules for specific services and applications.
Multi-server management: Manage multiple servers from a single Webmin instance with cluster features.
SSL/TLS support: Secure the web interface with HTTPS and certificate management.
